Utilities

Class UserChangeEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.EventObject
      • java.awt.AWTEvent
        • Utilities.UserChangeEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class UserChangeEvent
extends java.awt.AWTEvent
    Event raised when a candidate's connection status is changed.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserChangeEvent(int id, boolean login)
      Creates a new UserChangeEvent which specify that a candidate has logged in or logged out.
      UserChangeEvent(int uid, int qid)
      Creates a new UserChangeEvent which specify that a candidate has submitted answer to a question.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserChangeEvent

        public UserChangeEvent(int id,
               boolean login)
        Creates a new UserChangeEvent which specify that a candidate has logged in or logged out.
        Parameters:
        id - Id of the involved candidate.
        login - True if user has logged in; False otherwise.

      • UserChangeEvent

        public UserChangeEvent(int uid,
               int qid)
        Creates a new UserChangeEvent which specify that a candidate has submitted answer to a question.
        Parameters:
        uid - Id of the candidate.
        qid - Id of the question involved.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserId

        public int getUserId()
        Gets the candidates id who is involved.
        Returns:
        Id of the candidate.

      • mLoginStatus

        public boolean mLoginStatus()
        Gets if the candidate is logged in or logged out.
        Returns:
        True if logged in; False if logged out.

      • getQuestionId

        public int getQuestionId()
        Gets the question id involved. -1 if no question is involved.
        Returns:
        Id of the question. -1 if no question is involved.
